description: Really good quality cocktails, and this is judging from just one.  Their main bartender looked like he had a little science experiment going on as he focused on each cocktail and methodically measured the ingredients.  Our cocktail (shoot I forgot the name) was sweet just enough and it hit the spot.  This place was hopping on a Friday night, and I liked the vibe.  I'd come back!
author: Maile N.

description: A terrible bar with nothing to offer. Drinks that take 20 mins to make and servers who are bossy and pushy. I had a group of friends that went here and we were all disappointed with the service and staff. I am sad that this bar/ restaurant even exists. Please do yourself a favor and don't go.
author: Griffin C.

description: I've been here for dinner twice and brunch once and each time I was blown away.  The menu isn't the biggest thing around, but everything on it is superb.  Smaller plates, great for sharing.  The place is small and you don't have a lot of room between the tables, but it's nothing that should stop you from enjoying yourself.  Great for a date, or a quick bite before a show at the Independent.  Enclosed patio out front where they allow dogs ... greatest thing ever for you dog owners out there.
author: Jarrod H.

description:
Felt the need to finally review this place. I live in the neighborhood and have been giving the benefit of the doubt to servers/staff the past 4-5 times that I've visited. Clearly, there is a pattern. The service is terrible. Twice that I've gone for dinner/drinks our order was completely forgotten (twice!) 
Today I was there for 1 &1/2 hrs and never once had a server come back to ask if we wanted anything else... or refill out water. When I finally flagged someone down to ask for a beer it was slid down the communal table 1/4 poured and with attitude.  Not to mention that same server preceded to spill a glass of water on another patron without any sincere remorse.  This place is never busy because the service stinks.  And the food is... meh.
Don't normally review but given the numerous bad experiences I had to speak some truth. Hopefully they will take these reviews in to consideration and instill some empathy and work ethic into the staff.
author: Sharon K.

description: Very cool and stylish place. We had kale salad and the tuna dish and both were amazing.  They have a decent beer selection and the bar looks very well stocked
author: Mirjam S.

description: Whilst the restaurant was relatively quiet, and we were enjoying our time, the owner asked us to move tables without any clear rationale. The poor way he handled this has left me with a sour taste for his establishment.
author: Josh B.

description:
Truly, amazing. And fun too. Trust me.

I highly recommend.

A must try.

One of a kind.
author: Donald K.

description:
Oh my lord! 

OUTSTANDING FOOD!!! 

Our family were visiting San Fran, randomly spotted this gem, went in for brunch, and oh an what an amazing  brunch it was!! Everything on the menu looked so good, so to ensure we don't miss out we ordered everything and I'm so glad we did.  I can't remember the names of the meals we had but they literally were all delicious,oh and the cocktails! These guys know what they're doing. 

If I lived in San Fran this could be my regular Sunday brunch spot, can't wait to come back and try the dinner menu! 

You guys rule, wish more places nailed food like you do!
author: Sepi S.

description: This place is fantastic! Haley is the sweetest host and the beer selections were great, will be coming back for sure. Make sure to try the burgers and craft drinks !!
author: Jonathan G.

description: There are so many great gems on Divisidero, including Horsefeather. The front patio is charming and bright, the bar area is cozy and has a neighborhood feel. The cocktails are delicious here and the bartenders are friendly and patient with you! I'd totally come back here over and over again!
author: Lauren L.

description:
Great addition to the neighborhood. Cocktails were creative, excellent and the staff was great. Can't speak to the food as we just had drinks but I tasted the Mad Dog, Strawberry Hill and California Cooler; all three were on point. 

The California Cooler was the star of the show - don't miss it if you like gin based drinks.
author: Ash K.

description: Cool ambience with a great crowd, good selection of beers for a wide range of palettes . Did not eat but my friend said the shrimp curry was spot on, will go again.
author: Awasi A.

description: I've lived in the city for ~5 years and go out to eat 5+ times/week. The night we went, the service was hellacious: hostess pretended she called after we checked in (to let us know the table was ready) but never did, waitress was curt and unwelcoming, service was extremely slow; overall pretty poor. Food was mediocre. Ambience was solid. I live a few blocks away but would only go back to grab a drink.
author: Chris H.

description: Awesome atmosphere. Came around 8pm on a Friday table for 2 and sat almost immediately. Really good unique cocktails, and the food was amazing and filling. Got the kale salad, pulled pork tacos and the tuna poke bowl. Food came super quick and service was very friendly.
author: Toby C.

description:
I love the look of this place...lots of succulents and there's both a loungey indoor darkly lit area and a bright, well-lit outdoor area (with heaters!). The bar is beautiful. Food-wise and service wise is where there was a downfall. 
I was content after going here the first time and ordering the kale salad which is doused in a creamy dressing. It was what I was in the mood for at the time but really a bit overdressed. 
Second visit, I ordered the beef and broccoli which was rather salty, also very overdressed, and some
of the scallions tasted like soap. My friend ordered the pastrami which was honestly terrible. Flavors were off and didn't meld well with one another. Portions were small given the price. I'll go back most likely as I enjoy the vibe, but might just stick to drinks or apps. 
Oh, so the other thing was that our waitress was way out there during the second visit...her facial expressions and even little comments were so bizarre and made us a tad uncomfortable. She wasn't professional IMO and didn't give genuine recs or give off any positivity in general. Odd..
author: Caitlin G.

description: Great cocktails, beautiful environment, & pretty decent eats too! Love this neighborhood joint. Why the 3 stars? Took us almost 30 minutes, 2 different requests after initial order just to get our drinks. Ridiculous. I went back & almost as bad the same indifferent service. The server would deliver a neighboring table's order & head back to the bar, not even look up or around at the other tables clearly trying to get her attention. Who is training these waiters to be so blasé? Step up your service game! Your tables shouldn't have to send up smoke signals to get your attention.
author: Jamie R.

description: Gorgeous. Good drinks. Not so spectacular on the service. I don't know why yelp decided that this review was too short. Im tired of reading long reviews.
author: Gernaut A.

description: Great drinks and food! I ordered the Champipple and the tuna poke bowl.  The heated porch was also great.  The only downside was that it was really loud and crowded (we were lucky to get a seat at 7 on a Thursday). I will definitely be back.
author: Janelle F.

description: The fried chicken with 2 sides is so incredibly delicious! It came with hummus and Sriracha Cole slaw, WOW!  The drinks and ambience are also great. I recommend sitting at the tables in the front- a cool outdoorsy vibe indoors. Gorgeous spot with excellent food and service!
author: Jezzica B.

description: The bartender I dealt with wasn't super great considering they're going for a complex cocktail vibe with their menu. I've never had resistance in explaining the elements of a drink. Their drinks also represent themselves as complex but are just so-so. Was not blown away. Prices are decent. I met the owner and tried to give feedback but he wasn't interested. Feel like they could be more upscale if their cocktails were better and they were nicer. Cute decor.
author: Cathy L.

description: Cool spot! I'm a fan of the other bars that these owners have built around the Bay Area (Tupper and Reed in berkeley, Bourbon and Branch in SF), and this place did not disappoint. It's simple yet has a very warm neighborhood feel to it. Drinks are standard prices, and very delicious. Also had quite an extensive food menu for a bar. Would definitely come back.
author: Tanay J.

description: I can't write anything less than a raving review. This place is a savior for quick yet incredibly flavorful food. It's SOOOO delicious and with clean ingredients. Thank you guys for existing. My favorite spot in SF. And without being a scene!! Thank you again.
author: Megan M.

description: Beautiful bar, inventive cocktails... but no vibe in this bar. The bartenders are very cold limit unpleasant. I live close by, but this place is definitely not a friendly neighborhood bar.
author: Arnaud M.

description: I was able to snag a table in the lush front patio for drinks with a friend after work. The ambiance and the delicious drinks are a winning combination. We didn't stick around for anything other than drinks, but the food offerings were tempting.
author: Patricia D.

description: Staff is attentive and friendly. The atmosphere is fun and bright if you sit outdoors with lots of greenery and sun shining through the glass ceiling. They also have heat lamps to keep you warm on those gloomy afternoons. We didn't have the food but this is a great place to chill with friends before dinner or after lunch.
author: Marie r.

description: Dropped by here late on their opening night on Wednesday. Didn't realize they had JUST opened. Great spot! Delicious drinks, nice atmosphere, amazing bartenders. Definitely going to come back here. Looked hella crowded earlier in the evening, so I might just keep coming here in their later hours.
author: Nodira K.

description:
Glad we stumbled upon this place. Perfect ambiance for a late-night dinner and cocktail. Drinks were unique and very boozy. We split 3 dishes between 2 very hungry people, and it was the right amount of food. Great interior design, and we sat in the enclosed (heated) patio. Nice mix of young/old, diners/drinkers, different tribes of people.

Seat yourself. You have to be active in getting your server's attention. Service is hands-off (which was fine for a slow intimate meal); probably not for you if you demand a lot of attention from your waiter or are in a rush.
author: Tara P.

description: Live in the neighborhood, tried Horsefeather for the first time. Had a delicious cocktail and the fried chicken, both were excellent.
author: Mary R.

description: Not anywhere near the same quality as Bourbon and Branch - which I heard was related. Perhaps just the same theme decorator? I wish they focused less on themes and more on quality drinks. As usual I did the Sazerac test. The drinks didn't pass. Merely decent to.. a friend refused to drink hers. Not sure how they hired or trained but I sure hope they improve. I'll update my review once I notice a difference.
author: Esso E.

description: Visited horsefeather on a Wednesday night. Place has a nice vibe but the service, prices, and food portions were well below average. I ordered chips and queso and got a small bowl of queso and about 20 chips. Finished all the chips and had leftover queso. Asked waitress for more chips and she wanted to charge me. Charging for more chips is amateur. Beer selection was awful. Ordered a vodka soda and it tasted like soda water. Not right the proportion of vodka to soda. For a cocktail bar this seemed off. Their signature cocktails were great, but everything else very mediocre. Overall not worth a return visit.
author: Kyle W.

description: Wandered in last Friday for the cocktails and stayed for the food! Burger was on point and had some of the best wings I've ever had!
author: Philip M.

description: Delicious, thirst quenching cocktails and super friendly, engaging staff! My new spot!
author: Vanessa S.

description: This spot was clean with great service, fun place to grab a cocktail. Bartenders were friendly with good recommendations on drinks.
author: Teddy Z.

description: The front patio is cute, good chilaquiles, and good Bloody Mary. If you get here before 11, there shouldn't be a huge line. You can also ask them to turn on the heaters if it's cold!
author: Sofia R.

description: We came for some specialty cocktails because we heard they're great but wow, the food.  Who would have thought?  Unreal. Cuisine A++.  We had the ceviche and the raviolis and we can't stop talking about it.  And yes the drinks also lives up to the reputation.
author: Mister H.

description: Love the ambience. Snag a table in the closed-in front patio if you can. Food is also great, particularly the pork tacos (with homemade tortillas) and fried chicken.
author: Brady W.

description: Finally ventured over to this new spot on Divis that's had a buzz since it opened. Horsefeathers is a new American bar and grill featuring expertly crafted cocktails, beer & wine, and a select but delicious menu. It was a solid winner the afternoon I popped over for some Halibut ceviche and a Sun Country Mezcal cocktail. Though a tad cold due to the SF's random days of summer fog and an open air courtyard, one cannot fault it's well appointed decor, good food, and great drinks, plus when Talking Heads, "This Must Be The Place" played, so maybe it is.
author: HUNTER B.

description: Rather short cocktail list, and strong fare to boot. Still not a bad place if it's not packed
author: Tom S.

description: This place is exceptional! Burger is really solid! Drinks were good, and the staff was friendly!
author: Zachary T.

description: Very cool place.  We sat in the enclosed glass entry area for brunch.  I had a great cocktail, the Howland, and it was delicious.  I had the albacore and my companions had burgers.  The waitress was very cool (bangs and tattoos on her arms).  Overall wonderful!  I'd go back!
author: R M.

description: Holy crap, came for a beer and stayed for dinner. Worked my way through the killer cocktail menu before I realized that pulled pork tacos and fried rice sounded amazing...and they were. Do yourself a favor and eat some food here. Love Eric.
author: Eric F.

description:
Last night I ordered a drink from the menu that was so syrupy sweet I couldn't drink it. I let the bartender know- in as nice a way I could- and asked for a dirty martini instead. I had my money out to show I was willing to pay for the second drink, but he told me it was on the house. After a few sips it was very apparent that he had served me a drink with little to no alcohol in it. It was just icy olive water. 
So if you don't like your drink at horsefeather- be sure to keep it to yourself. You may end up with a bum drink and a really good reason to never go back.
author: Mikayla C.

description: Pretty nice design and decor to the space. I like the menu with shaken cocktails and a pretty solid beer selection. Did not get the best vibes from a bartender that passed me up repeatedly which had the effect of deciding to close my tab rather than grab another drink. Prices are a bit steep. Will not be coming back.
author: Brad M.

description: This would be a great place to meet a friend after work for a drink. The interior is beautiful. The drinks are great. The food is good, but not the main attraction. We came on a weeknight and it was very busy so we were lucky to grab a table way in the back. It was dark, like, waaay dark back there. I'm all for low lighting but this was overkill. It's a new place so maybe they're waiting on adding lighting in that section or something. The service was efficient and friendly considering how busy it was.
author: Jerry L.

description: Love this new edition to the Divis bar scene. Great vibe and decorations. Lots of locals hanging out, not overly packed and excellent extra dirty vodka martini!
author: Jeanna B.

description: Wish they opened earlier! Great drinks and great food. Awesome vibe, def be back soon!
author: Ron M.

description: Ridiculous. Won't accommodate any dietary restrictions and was offered a discount for the inconvenience but then the manager rescinded the offer. Slow service, to boot.
author: Tara S.

description: I had probably the best burger of my life here. The bun was to die for. Cute patio outside, too.
author: Gina T.

description: Quite possibly my favorite brunch in SF. The drinks are original with subtle nuances and far exceeded my expectations, even with eight years of mixology in SF under my belt. The ambiance is great-- could spend all afternoon on the sunlit and plant-filled patio. The two dishes we shared were fantastic-- everyone should try the chilaquiles, and the house-made bacon made me momentarily forget that bacon is overdone.
author: Stuart G.

description: Why on earth would your well vodka(Smirnoff) be $11? Are you insane? Your specialty cocktails range from $10-$13. Let me ask again. Why on earth would your well vodka(Smirnoff) be $11? You suck.
author: Mojo M.

description: Ugh where to start. Came here today when it was relatively quiet - 5pm. Sat ourselves on the patio and waited and waited. Decided to belly up to the bar and STILL waited even though there were 3 people behind the bar. My husband made a sarcastic remark about the wait being equal to the wait outside and someone heard and finally gave us a menu. We ordered a couple of drinks and food. When our food was delivered, we'd finished our drinks and the bartender said "do you want some water?" We thought it was odd that he didn't ask if we wanted another round. We ended up ordering another round from a different bartender. The entire time we sort of felt like they just didn't want us there. They were clearly most interested in talking & joking around with each other over providing welcoming service. The only positive was the kitchen - they hustled and were quick to fire up the orders. Spent a regretful $115. Don't waste your time or money here - Nopa down the street is MUCH better.
author: Noel A.

description: Visited here for a friends birthday drinks two weeks ago. We were seated in the front closed in patio area which was a great place to be seated. I ate the beef with oyster sauce and it was one of the best meals I had had in a while and for such a reasonable price. Other people at the table had fried chicken and commented about the perfect portion size. I am not a big gin drinker, actually I hate it but the strawberry hill was delicious and I stuck to it all night. The rest of the table collectively had all other cocktails on the menu and we all tasted them, not one disappointed! Fantastic restaurant and can't wait to go back again soon.
author: Relle C.

description: The patio in the front draws in a crowd but even on a Friday night we were able to grab a table inside. The food and drinks were delicious and i would defiantly suggest the Albacore Poke.  Cocktails are between $10-12 which is pretty average and the bartenders know how to make some good drinks, i myself got a gin gimlet. Only reason I am knocking a star off is for the poor service. Get ready to make a scene if you want anything since they have you seat your self and then you have to fight for the attention of a waiter or waitress to  grab a menu or order a drink.
author: Emily V.

description: This place is amazing!  The ambiance, the decor, the food and drink - wow!  My husband and I came in for some quick drinks to check out this new place.  We were amazed at the thought and detail put into the cocktails.  I had the California Cooler - Celery juice, lime, thyme, sauvignon blanc, horseradish, sparkling wine, gin.  What an interesting combination of flavors -and it was so tasty!  We also had the ceviche.  The owners definitely put some time into selecting the decor, the detail of the entire place really shows.
author: Michelle H.

description: Horsefeather looks amazing! Beautiful light wood and blue accents, perfectly chilled cocktails from a great staff. Creative food options too! Very exciting. Delicious! Get the Nightrain and Champipple. And chicken wingggggggzzzzz
author: Katherine D.

description:
Popped in here yesterday for a bite around 5pm. No too packed, waited for a couple to finish at the bar and sat down with friends. The female bartender was friendly and brought us a menu. Great so far. A second bartender appeared soon after, however this guy was not friendly. His "I'm way to cool" tuff guy attitude was an immediate turn off. The bartender I'm alluding to has a freckled face. My friend asked to taste an IPA, which this guy seemed even more hostile to.
He went on mixing drinks in front of me so I leaned forward and asked him if they had any non alcoholic drinks. He basically told me to zip it because he was way too busy to talk. You my friend need to find other employment ( maybe a dive bar somewhere )!! Every bartender I have come across can mix drinks and talk at the same time, they are also generally nice people!! 
We departed the bar not wanting to deal with this for the rest of our time here. We sat in patio and did receive great service from our server. She was friendly sweet and helpful. Food was great and an otherwise good experience.
author: James H.

description: This place is mediocre at best. I was really excited to finally try out Horsefeather bur left extremely disappointed. The bartenders are straight up neglectful and rude. How long does it take to get a drink around here? The answer is way too long. The cocktails are decently priced 10-12 dollars but aren't worth the wait or the attitude the bartenders have here. The food is good though and would be the only thing that would bring me back here. I would recommend sitting at a table where the servers will go up to you and you don't need to interact with the bartenders. I will probably avoid this place in the future and get a far better cocktail and service next door at Nopa.
author: Chelsea R.
